data.title: Fixed BetterCharacterControl "flickering" when not moving.
data.body:
Sometimes, when the BetterCharacterControl is not moving, it flickers due it physics being always active. The reason for it being always active is that on the prePhysicsTick method it always set the rigidBody's linear velocity (and the method PhysicsRigidBody.setLinearVelocity(Vector3f) reactivates the physics each time is called).

The fix consist on just comparing if the current velocity and the setting one aren't the same and, thus, not setting it (using ZERO_TOLERANCE instead 0 to best results).

data.title: Suggestion: accept 'seed' parameter for terrain.ParticleDepositionHeightMap
data.body: The common design pattern for most of the random-based HeightMap generators (HillHeight, FaultHeight, ..) is to accept a 'seed' value for the random number generator.  This is very useful for testing/debugging when you want to generate the same pattern over and over again. I am not seeing anything in ParticleDepositionHeightMap that would preclude this as an option.

data.title: SDK 3.0 - Editor controls not working as expected
data.body:
Hello,

I've been experiencing several problems with the editor(s) of the jME SDK version 3.0. This includes, that I can't navigate using the arrow keys or insert a new line using enter. Thus, marking text using the keyboard is not possible. Marking text using the mouse also doesn't show any signs of markered text (e.g. a blue background and white foreground). Assuming the XML editor is different from the java editor, I must admit to experience these bugs in every editor window. 
I am running the JME SDK (64-bit) on Windows 7. The SDK runs in Java 1.7.0_51, 64 bit.

data.title: .j3md braces issue
data.body:
Having braces in next line in j3md file results in empty parameters list while creating/editing j3m file in SDK 3.0. I don't know if the problem exists in 3.1.
The engine itself can handle such syntax and all materials are processed correctly.

data.title: Removed useless Quaternion from AbstractPhysicsControl
data.body: The private **tmp_inverseWorldRotation** quaternion is only used to make calculations that are completely lost and, thus, unnecessary.

data.title: fix #383 : in PhysicsRigidBody the old statement in read() (l.741) was always false
com.jme3.bullet.objects.PhysicsRigidBody # 740/741 -  incorrect use of ==  in .read()
opengl3: use GLSLCompat with material Lighting, Particle, ShowNormals…
data.body: …, Sky

data.title: Interpolate particle positions
data.body:
Currently there is a problem with ParticleEmitter. It doesn't take into account the the distance it has travelled between updates. Or at least this is my interpretation - I didn't invent this solution. methusalah did. Please see the following threads for more information:

http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/interpolation-of-particle-spawning-point/30385/9
http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/interpolation-of-particle-spawning-point-when-emitter-has-moved/30400

The following images are from my game. FPS is 60 and the emitter emits 2000 particles per second. Projectile's linear speed is 200 world units / s (it uses RigidBodyControl).

Without interpolation
![Without interpolation](http://i.imgur.com/6OXVf0f.png)

With interpolation
![With interpolation](http://i.imgur.com/Ou5gr5e.png)

data.title: Changing number of samples then calling app.restart() causes text to vanish
jogl: use pixel unit for window's dimension (fix issue on MaxOS X)
Add support for Android ARMv8 platform detection
data.body:
We should add detection support for ARMv8 in the JmeAndroidSystem.

I have a 64-bit ARMv8 phone which reports the following.

```
os.name = linux
os.arch = aarch64
```

This indicates a 64 bit ARMv8.

Implementation wise we should probably add a new platform `Android_ARM8` as well as some more detection code in both JmeAndroidSystem to detect this platform and expand `is64Bit()` in JmeSystemDelegate to return true for `aarch64` and false for `aarch32`.

data.title: opengl3: add GLSLCompat into Gui.j3md
Added support to Logitech F310
data.body: For both DirectInput and XInput mode. Also tentatively added support of alternate version of xbox360 controller.

data.title: jogl: some fixes about mouse handler
data.body:
- Y hotspot is top in jogl, and bottom in jme
- in jme when mouse is invisible it should be confined into the window (on mac it could go out of the window)
- when window doesn't has the focus the mouse should not behave like when has the focus like 
  - trying to re-center
  - stay invisible

data.title: TestPBRLighting crashes with an invalid enum error when assertions are enabled.
data.body:
Enable assertion, launch TestPBRLighting, you got it.
invalid enum on a glCheckError.
Works fine otherwise, but still...

data.title: SphereCollisionShape printing unnecessary warnings
data.body:
In SphereCollisionShape, the setScale() method prints a warning because it cannot be scaled,
however createShape(), which is called by the constructor also calls setScale thus leading to error messages whenever you create a SphereCollisionShape.

From forum thread: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/4x-faster-quaternion-vector-multiplication/32618/25

data.title: Can we get a new minor release?
data.body:
I'm having this issue on both of my computers: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/invalidenum-1208-wont-go-away/33755/22

It stops me from using jMonkeyEngine 3.1, and it makes me very sad. If I understand correctly, the fix is already in the source code (https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/commit/78d2d6e944116fa61b24b4aee89cdf13459d2795), we just need to release a new version and problem solved. I'd do that if I could compile the source but I'm having some trouble with that.

data.title: Native bullet crash when using ragdoll without bones
Fixed Issue #46 : The MaterialViewer will now simply ignore not available textures instead of crashing
data.body: Still had that in my repo, I hope it's done the way you imagined :)

data.title: Vector3f.equals() fails for (-0, 0, 0)
data.body:
It's pretty simple to reproduce:

```
System.out.println(Vector3f.ZERO.equals(new Vector3f(0f, -0f, 0f)));
```

This will print out "false" because Float.compare() seems to see -0 and 0 as a different thing.
Unfortunately this is quite confusing for the user and built in code which checks for Vector3f.ZERO.

Don't ask me how I got to Vectors with -0 (it appeared arithmetically and wierdly java allows that)

data.title: Lights : added light v. sphere intersection
data.body:
- implementations of intersectsSphere() for Ambient / Directional / Point / Spot  Light
  (see #362)

data.title: BitmapFont positions text incorrectly when VAlign is set to "Center" or "Bottom"
DefaultLightFilter does not support BoundingSphere
data.body:
If the user is using bounding spheres in their scene graph, the following error will appear:
`UnsupportedOperationException: Only AABB supported for now`

jME3 lights need to implement an intersectSphere method in order to support light v. sphere intersection.
